entry.title: congratulations, you adopted a spider!
entry.summary:
Author: maraudersmqry

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 107,730Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 2,797

Summary: Peter was meant to be forgotten, he didn’t think that meant being dropped in Gotham. Or in his eight-year-old body, in the least. Or with vigilantes trying to adopt him!   IN WHICH, Dr. Strange gave Peter one last chance at a life, instead of being emo around the faces who no longer recognized him.

entry.title: Apex of The Heart
entry.summary:
Author: rewritethestories

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,781Chapters: 9/9Kudos: 1

Summary: Bruce, Clark, and Harvey grew up side by side in the high-pressure world of Formula One, rising from karting circuits to the professional grid with a bond that blurred the line between friendship and something more. When a devastating crash changes everything, miscommunication and pride fracture what they never quite defined. Years later, as Bruce and Clark build a life, and a family, together, the past returns in ways none of them expected. It's as the tags say.

entry.title: raison d'être
entry.summary:
Author: ilovepinkandcoffee

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,671Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 431

Summary: (n.) a reason for existingA year after the Riddler’s attack on Gotham, Batman struggles to repair a city fractured and drowning in crime. But when rumors spread through Gotham’s criminal underworld about an alien hero in Metropolis—an otherworldly figure with god-like powers who’s changing the course of history—Bruce can't help but be skeptical. But his concerns are confirmed when this so-called "Superman," arrives in Gotham one night during his patrol, bringing with him a wave of chaos that threatens to disrupt the fragile balance he has fought so hard to maintain.Clark had heard about Gotham City when he first arrived at Metropolis—a lawless, crime-ridden city plagued with corruption—but he had never felt the need to enter its borders. That is until he learns of a mysterious vigilante known as "The Batman," a figure who, like him, seeks justice for his city and its people, his curiosity gets the better of him. Drawn to the idea of meeting someone with a shared mission, Clark decides to seek out the elusive hero, after all, nothing bad can come out of it can it? But boy was he wrong.

entry.title: Seeing Red and Blue
entry.summary:
Author: Mauve_Muse

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 54,173Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 280

Summary: Lex Luthor knew how to stop Superman from flying—he just had to fly him somewhere else first. He thought his bases were covered. Then the alien's words echoed back to him, revealing the bat-shaped hole in his otherwise genius plan. Batman was a problem. Batman was the one rumored to monitor Superman’s vitals, who had ships that could cross galaxies, who likely had contingencies for red-sun scenarios, and—more importantly—the one man who would never stop looking. If Superman vanished, Batman would be on his heels before Lex had even cleared the atmosphere. So Batman had to go too. OR Superbat is stranded on a red sun planet <3

entry.title: You can take the boy from the circus
entry.summary:
Author: Gotham_Blight

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 53,357Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 343

Summary: Damian Al-Ghul Wayne had everything at one point. He was a prince. Ibn al Xu'ffasch. Son of the bat. Heir to the demon. He had never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his palace in Nanda Parbat. He had never asked to be shipped to a gloomy, grey city. Even when his father kept taking in orphans and ruining his plans for inheritance, Damian stood steadfast. But then his father died, leaving behind his newest orphan. A tiny acrobat with watery blue eyes and black curls, who spoke no English. Damian knew the boy never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his circus troupe. Damian knew he needed to be there for him.

entry.title: loving can heal, loving can mend your soul
entry.summary:
Author: burningredbutitsgolden

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,018Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 52

Summary: After unbuckling Lian from her carseat, they made the too-long trek from Roy's car to the front door of Wayne Manor. Roy looked over at Jason, smiling as he noticed his daughter—their daughter—clasping the man's hand.  "I love you," Jason breathed out, as though he had to remind himself. He took a deep breath as Roy knocked on the door.OR: Jason and Roy have been dating for nearly two years.
